title: Polygon mumbai persistant crashing
body:
I am running Erigon with Mumbai (testnet) for now and it crashes daily, mostly even multiple times a day. That is with Testnet.
Running 3 nodes on dedicated metal servers in our hosting facility. All same Hardware. 64GB Ram, 8 TB SSSD, 16 Cores.

**Before it is suggested there is a hardware issue**: already 2 servers were replaced and errors keep coming. It can be ruled out as highly unlikely as it would mean 2 brand new deviced fail from their first day of action. 

The node is under rather heavy RPC load as every block is fully parsed but only one of them. The other too sit idle in case one node goes down. The feeling is that the nodes go down as they are used by RPC calls.

I have unfortunately not more details. Below are the first error reports. it would be thousands of lines for all of them. I can share them if required.

```

[INFO] [02-21|23:38:27.232] [2/16 Headers] Waiting for headers...    from=32272060
fatal error: concurrent map iteration and map write

goroutine 4102 [running]:

github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/sentry/sentry.(*MultiClient).newBlock66(0xc02ac2ad80, {0x2b545b8, 0xc0017b4340}, 0xc08e7d3630, {0x2b726e0, 0xc028695e78})

        github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/sentry/sentry/sentry_multi_client.go:679 +0xb9
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/sentry/sentry.pumpStreamLoop[...].func2()

created by github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/sentry/sentry.pumpStreamLoop[...]
        github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/cmd/sentry/sentry/sentry_multi_client.go:212 +0x2ce

goroutine 1 [chan receive, 217 minutes]:
github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/node.(*Node).Wait(...)

github.com/urfave/cli/v2.(*Command).Run(0xc001116640, 0xc001133840, {0xc000052070, 0x7, 0x7})
        github.com/urfave/cli/v2@v2.23.5/command.go:271 +0xaab
github.com/urfave/cli/v2.(*App).RunContext(0xc001150000, {0x2b545f0?, 0xc000056088}, {0xc000052070, 0x7, 0x7})
        github.com/urfave/cli/v2@v2.23.5/app.go:329 +0x665
github.com/urfave/cli/v2.(*App).Run(...)
        github.com/urfave/cli/v2@v2.23.5/app.go:306
main.main()

```

I use the fork branch of matic to run, and I have not encountered this problem. I suggest you use it too
https://github.com/maticnetwork/erigon.git
I am running 0.0.5 of maticnetwork and on the other 0.0.4 and on both the same. tried 2.36 of ledgerwatch, same problem

Hi @theSwissAlex,

Which version are you running?  I can see a commit that looks to fix this issue on 29/01/2023.  Looks like this got into version 2.37.0.

> Hi @theSwissAlex,
> 
> Which version are you running? I can see a commit that looks to fix this issue on 29/01/2023. Looks like this got into version 2.37.0.

I am running 0.0.5 from https://github.com/maticnetwork/erigon.git

Hi @theSwissAlex, if you're running a fork you'll need to wait until the upstream is pulled and takes the changes in version 2.37.0 from the erigon repo for this issue.  I'm closing the issue for now as that is out of our hands.
yes. thanks a lot for your help
